info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 11:36PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
At 1136 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Azle, moving east at 35 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
This strong thunderstorm will be near... Eagle Mountain, Fort Worth, and Azle around 1140 PM CDT. Lake Worth around 1145 PM CDT. Sansom Park, River Oaks, and Saginaw around 1150 PM CDT. Blue Mound around 1155 PM CDT. North Richland Hills, Haltom City, and Watauga around 1200 AM CDT. Keller, Richland Hills, and Hurst around 1205 AM CDT. Colleyville around 1210 AM CDT.
Other locations impacted by this storm include Lake Worth, Westover Hills, Lakeside, Sanctuary, La Junta, Highland Addition, Lake Arlington, Dalworthington Gardens, and Grapevine Lake.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 35W between mile markers 49 and 65. Interstate 20 between mile markers 412 and 417. Interstate 30 between mile markers 4 and 31.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Parker and central Tarrant Counties through 1215 AM CDT
